sourceMeaningMnemonic: The part of the <radical>grain</radical> people <radical>favor</radical> the most is the <kanji>head of the plant</kanji>. You don't eat the stems and leaves of rice or wheat plants, right? You eat the head where the grains are.
meaningInfo: Imagine yourself walking through a field of rice plants. Now look very closely at the head of the plant in front of you. See the rice bunched up there? That's the good stuff.
readingMnemonic: When you want to harvest the <kanji>head of the plant</kanji> you'd like to eat, you need to use a <reading>hoe</reading> (<ja>ほ</ja>). Using a hoe, you can dig up the bottom of the plant without injuring the head.
readingInfo: Imagine working in a field of rice and using a hoe so you don't injure the head of the plant. You're sweating and it's hot, but you keep at it.
